meanings.definition: A folded corner of a page in a book.
meanings.sent1: I saw a dogear in my favorite novel.
meanings.sent2: She found a dogear in her textbook while studying.
meanings.sent3: The dogear in the library book made the librarian chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The dogear was like a little flag waving from the page.
meanings.sent5: The dogear peeked out, reminding me where I left off reading.

meanings.definition: To fold down the corner of a page in a book to mark a place.
meanings.sent1: Please don't dogear the pages of the library books.
meanings.sent2: He would dogear the pages of his favorite novels to remember the good parts.
meanings.sent3: She would playfully dogear the pages of her friend's books as a prank.
meanings.sent4: His habit of dogearing pages showed his love for reading.
meanings.sent5: I dogear my recipe books to quickly find my favorite dishes.

meanings.definition: A small triangular piece of paper used as a bookmark.
meanings.sent1: She placed a dogear in her journal to mark her thoughts.
meanings.sent2: The dogear fell out of the book as she turned the pages.
meanings.sent3: The dogear was so tiny, it almost got lost in the book.
meanings.sent4: The dogear served as a colorful marker in the novel.
meanings.sent5: He used a dogear to save his place in the story before bedtime.
